Title: Despite Ben-Gvir's resignation, his right-hand man is still runni...
Description: Ben-Gvir's chief of staff, Hanamel Dorfman, is a right-wing extremist who was once a person of interest for the Shin Bet. He was supposed to step down from the National Security Ministry in February, but 'in practice, acts as both minister and director general,' according to one senior security official

Title: What would revenge do? Will it bring back Hamza or Youssef?'
Description: For 460 days, Bashir Alziadana fought to return his family members, who were taken hostage alive, but their bodies were returned to Israel by the IDF two months ago. 'People aren't talking enough about what to do instead of revenge,' he said

Description: What is its origin? When did it begin? Why did many Jews scorn Purim – and is the underlying tale of love, murder and betrayal true?

Title: Israeli pizzerias named among Asia's best for the second year in ...
Description: Haifa-based NeoPolitan achieved the highest placing for an Israeli pizza in the history of the guide, alongside Jerusalem-based Le Piedra, which was named for the second year in a row on a list of the 50 best pizzas in Asia

Title: Yemen's Houthis to resume attacks on Israeli ships until Israel u...
Description: Houthis say they will renew a naval blockade targeting Israeli–owned vessels passing through Yemen's naval regions, in solidarity with Palestinians in the Gaza Strip after Israel froze incoming aid. The Houthis launched more than 100 attacks targeting shipping from November 2023

Description: Houthis say they will renew a naval blockade targeting Israeli–owned vessels passing through Yemen's naval regions, in solidarity with Palestinians in the Gaza Strip after Israel froze incoming aid. The Houthis launched more than 100 attacks targeting shipping from November 2023

Title: Will Syria's leader artfully unite the country's clashing minorit...

Title: Freed Israeli hostage: Collapse of cease-fire meant 'humiliation,...
Description: In a TV interview, Omer Wenkert recounted his daily rations of three dates and half a pita, and the nearly 200 days he spent in solitary confinement deep underground. 'I can't stop thinking about them. People are still there, and just as I promised them, I won't rest until they all come home'

Title: Palestinian Authority condemns Hamas-U.S. direct talks, says grou...
Description: Palestinian political sources say the condemnation indicates the depth of the crisis between the PA and Hamas. The PA is also disappointed with Trump's Lebanese adviser, Massad Boulos, who adopted the Israeli government's narrative without mentioning the Palestinian position

Title: Syria's government signs a breakthrough deal with Kurdish-led aut...
Description: Syria's interim government announced the end of a days-long military operation against insurgents loyal to ousted president Bashar Assad, in the worst fighting since the end of the 13-year civil war in December

Title: Witkoff flies to Qatar to push Hamas, Israel to continue with dea...
Description: Israel's political echelon is demanding that Hamas agree to what it refers to as the Witkoff plan, which calls for releasing half of the living hostages – around 10 people – within the next few days, in one or more phases

Title: Doha, Riyadh, Baghdad: How Arafat's private jet is used for secre...
Description: Once used by former Palestinian leader Yasser Arafat, today the private jet has a new owner. Bashar Masri, Palestinian-American tycoon and the jet's owner, has reportedly been shuttling Trump's hostage envoy around the region

Title: Anger and distress about military draft in Israel's ultra-Orthodo...

Title: Two different 'Qatargates' are plaguing Netanyahu
Description: First came Qatar's cash-filled suitcases to Gaza in the years before October 7, now it's the Israeli prime minister's aides who allegedly did PR work for the Gulf state. For Netanyahu, there's plenty of hysteria to go around

Description: The Trump administration pointed to Columbia's 'continued inaction in the face of persistent harassment of Jewish students' as reasoning for canceling the grants and contracts

Title: Israeli university suspends lecturer who said IDF soldiers 'murde...
Description: Ben-Gurion University said it decided to suspend Ben Daniel as a result of 'a fear Ben Daniel's actions had crossed the line'

Title: Israeli university suspends lecturer who called IDF soldiers 'bab...
Description: Ben-Gurion University said Dr. Sebastian Ben Daniel 'crossed the line' when he claimed that Israeli soldiers 'murder babies, not because of orders, but because they were taught [to do so].'

Title: U.K.'s PM meets released hostage Eli Sharabi, calls his experienc...
Description: Prime Minister Keir Starmer met with Sharabi, whose British-Israeli wife and daughters were murdered on October 7, weeks after his release from Hamas captivity

Title: Weeks later, no one can explain why Israeli troops killed yet ano...
Description: While standing by chance near a kindergarten run by Save the Children in the West Bank village of Sebastia, Ahmad Jazar, 15, was shot to death by an Israeli soldier. 'Since the war in Gaza started,' says the head of the local council, 'there's nothing easier for Israelis than to shoot Palestinians'

Title: Weeks later, no one can explain why Israeli troops killed yet ano...

Title: Families of hostages whose bodies remain in Gaza captivity demand...
Description: Yael Adar, whose son Tamir was taken hostage wounded and died in captivity, said Israel's military rabbinate offered to perform a burial ceremony without his body. 'This kind of burial is closure for the government, not for us, she said, adding that the family 'rejected the proposal outright'

Title: Why Hamas sees U.S. hostage talks as an indirect path to politica...
Description: In spite of Donald Trump's threats, Hamas does not see contact with the U.S. as crossing a red line, but as an opportunity to upgrade its status – just as Syrian President Ahmad al-Sharaa did recently

Title: More than 200 killed in Syria clashes between government forces a...
Description: Fighting broke out Thursday near the country's coastal city of Latakia, after 16 government fighters were killed in an ambush, making it some of the worst violence carried out against the government since it assumed power in December

Title: Under gov't pressure, new army chief decides to end tenure of IDF...
Description: Hagari's request to be made the IDF's attache in the U.S. was denied, and the chief claimed he intends to promote officers who took part in Gaza combat. 'The hostages stand before our eyes – a goal of importance like no other,' Hagari wrote to his subordinates after the decision was announced

Title: In Iran, like in Gaza, Trump wields a sledgehammer but lacks a so...
Description: The U.S. President's dismissal of the Egyptian proposal for postwar Gaza shows he's given Netanyahu the reigns, while his aggressive foreign policy against Iran and Ukraine does not seem to be backed by a coherent plan

Title: Evacuated residents of Israel's north are required to return home...
Description: While some kibbutzim in north Israel are seeing their residents return home, other communities are still trying to deal with the war's damage, and hope the state will help them rebuild in time for the next school year

Title: Israeli indicted for driving terrorist who planted explosives on ...
Description: A 35-year-old resident of the central Israeli city of Holon was indicted, and is accused of driving the terrorist who planned last month's bus explosions from Bat Yam to the West Bank. His lawyer said he is held 'Under conditions for a man who made offenses against the state'

Title: Kidnapped? Missing? What really happened to a 9-year-old girl who...
Description: The girlfriend who says she saw what happened, the lapses in security-camera footage, the mysterious rituals at the nearby grave of a kabbala icon, a possible witness who came out of nowhere and then lapsed into a coma. A year has passed since 9-year-old Haymanot Kasau disappeared in Safed

Title: Evasion, cynicism and panic: Netanyahu's campaign against a state...

Title: Nine warning signs were missed by Israel before Oct. 7. So whose ...
Description: This week, Netanyahu finally downed his first culprit, as IDF chief Halevi's resignation came into effect. While Halevi's first to speak with the hostages' families, Netanyahu keeps himself busy by trying to decide on his next victim – Shin Bet chief Ronen Bar or Attorney General Gali Baharav-Miara

Title: U.S. to reportedly use AI to revoke visas of students it sees as ...
Description: The first such action reportedly took place on Wednesday when a students visa was revoked for 'Hamas-supporting disruptions.' Secretary of State Marco Rubio said on social media that the U.S. 'has zero tolerance for foreign visitors who support terrorists'

Title: Justice Ministry won't ban Israeli real estate agents from racial...
Description: The code, set to take effect next week, does not include a clause banning racism, despite many calls to do so. This comes after a precedent-setting settlement awarded a group of Arab renters 40,00 shekels after experiencing race-based discrimination

Title: Report: American-Israeli hostage Edan Alexander was starved, inte...
Description: Former hostages who contacted Alexander's family said he'd been in an underground tunnel for over 500 days without exposure to sunlight, shackled in chains for extended periods of time, a Channel 12 news report revealed

Description: If Netanyahu and Hamas are left to their own devices, the entire process will collapse. This is the moment for Trump to get back in the game

Title: Israel's Knesset passes law giving coalition control over judicia...
Description: The law, passed 56-48, shifts appointment power to a justice minister-led committee dominated by political figures, replacing the selection committee's role in approving candidates jointly proposed by the justice minister and the Supreme Court president

Title: The Ryan Reynolds effect: How the actor helped turn Israeli music...
Description: Yehezkel Raz, Spotify's second most­­­­­-streamed Israeli musician in the world, creates soft and delicate music, which attracts four million monthly listeners and hundreds of millions of streams

Title: Billions to Israel, truce, Gaza takeover plan: Trump to tout Mide...
Description: President Trump's speech comes on the heels of $11 billion weapons sales to Israel and amid his continued insistence on a U.S. takeover of Gaza and increasing deference to Israel on how to proceed with the hostage deal

Title: Arab League adopts Egyptian proposal for Palestinian Authority co...
Description: Egypt proposed that a committee of Gazan professionals, overseen by the Palestinian Authority, manage Gaza for six months before the PA assumes full control. The Egyptian plan also calls for Palestinian elections within a year

Title: At Arab summit, Egypt proposes Palestinian Authority control in G...
Description: Disagreements between the attending countries – including Egypt, Jordan, Saudi Arabia, Qatar, the UAE, and others – are likely to emerge over Gaza's governance. One key issue is the potential disarmament of Hamas, which Egypt thinks is unrealistic

Title: Family of hostage Matan Angrest share image from captivity, hopin...
Description: Captive IDF solder Matan Angrest's father said the family allowed publication of Matan's photograph as a protest against the prime minister's inaction. He also addressed the clashes between protesters and Knesset guards, recalling his 77-year-old father 'was choked and slammed to the floor'

Title: IDF decides not to investigate illegal expulsion of Palestinian f...
Description: The army acknowledged that the soldiers violated procedures, but chose to settle for a reprimand and declined to explain why it decided not to investigate the incident. 'This is evidence of a culture that grants immunity to soldiers who harm Palestinians,' said Roni Peli of the Yesh Din organization

Title: Arab leaders to meet in Cairo for emergency summit to discuss Gaz...
Description: Disagreements between the attending countries – including Egypt, Jordan, Saudi Arabia, Qatar, the UAE, and others – are likely to emerge over Gaza's governance. One key issue is the potential disarmament of Hamas, which Egypt thinks is unrealistic

Title: No defense, lax standards: IDF's initial probes into October 7 ma...
Description: The investigations published on Monday make it clear that Hamas was able to surprise the Israeli military thanks to the decline in procedural discipline and what border units were being called on to do. 'We forgot how to defend,' one of the investigators said

Title: Israeli army kills Hezbollah naval commander in south Lebanon air...

Title: Israel won't rule out cutting off Gaza electricity to pressure Ha...
Description: GAZA CEASE-FIRE: Israel blocks aid to Gaza as cease-fire's first stage ends; Israel willing to extend cease-fire's fist stage to allow for talks ■ EGYPT: New Gaza cease-fire agreement proposed, release of six Israeli hostages in exchange for withdrawal from Salah al-Din road and Philadelphi corridor ■ ISRAEL: Recently released Israeli hostages head to U.S. for meeting with President Trump

Title: Family of captive Israeli soldier okays publication of first sign...
Description: GAZA CEASE-FIRE: Israel to extend the cease-fire in Gaza for a few days, senior Israeli officials said ■ EGYPT: New cease-fire agreement proposed, release of six Israeli hostages in exchange for withdrawal from Salah al-Din road and Philadelphi corridor

Title: Alone in a tunnel with little food, brackish water: Freed hostage...
Description: Omer was released after 505 days in Hamas captivity. His father, Malki, says that his son suffered from anxiety and depression in captivity, but 'did not let himself break.' Along with other released hostages, Omer, accompanied by his mother, flew to the U.S. to meet with President Trump. He immediately said, 'I'll do everything I have to do,' says Malki

Title: Omer Shem Tov's family: He was alone in a dark narrow tunnel, wit...
Description: Omer was released after 505 days in Hamas captivity, his father, Malki says that his son suffered from anxiety and depression in captivity, but 'did not let himself break'. Omer flew with his mother and other released hostages to meet U.S. President Donald Trump. 'He didn't think twice,' says Malki. 'He immediately said, 'I'll do everything I have to do''

Title: IDF's Kfar Azza investigation: Terrorists massacred residents for...
Description: Kibbutz residents were killed in their homes despite IDF soldiers reaching them and promising to return, but were caught in battle before fulfilling those promises. Evacuations occurred while passing fallen bodies, and in some cases, under terrorist fire

Title: Netanyahu downplays meetings and relationship with media mogul at...
Description: In a hearing cut short by a Knesset session, Netanyahu denied concealing his ties to Bezeq owner Shaul Elovitch, asserting that, based on what he was informed, there was no conflict of interest

Title: Halting Gaza aid, Israel uses leverage to press Arab states on ex...
Description: As long as Israel enjoys full American backing for every decision, including violating agreements, it will continue to chart its own course to perpetuate its control over Gaza 'for as long as it takes'

Title: Stefanik booed at ADL conference speech praising Trump, labeling ...
Description: The U.S. ambassador to the UN nominee vowed 'no daylight' between the U.S. and Israel, adding that foreign students involved in antisemitic acts must be deported. The ADL says 83 percent of Jewish students have seen or experienced antisemitism

Title: IDF Investigation: How Hamas captured Nahal Oz army base on Octob...
Description: The investigation, published on Monday, reveals that the fall of Nahal Oz was directly linked to the disregard and negligence of orders by the entire IDF command chain, which led to the failure to safeguard the base. 'This is a severe systemic failure,' said the senior IDF commander who conducted the probe

Title: Investigation: Hamas attack on Nahal Oz IDF base was 'one of Oct....
Description: The investigation, published on Monday, reveals that the fall of Nahal Oz was directly linked to the disregard and negligence of orders by the entire IDF command chain, which led to the failure to safeguard the base. 'This is a severe systemic failure,' said the senior IDF commander who conducted the probe

Title: Why it's impossible to fully celebrate the Oscar success of 'No O...
Description: I fear that, just like the golden age of documentaries from Israel and Palestine that transformed my own appreciation for the genre, it isn't enough. The film will not stop the occupation

Title: Israeli culture minister urges theaters to avoid screening No Oth...
Description: After calling the film's win 'a sad moment,' the Likud minister said its 'one-sided and abstract narrative tarnishes Israel's wartime reputation.' Co-director Basel Adra stated the film 'reflects the harsh reality we've endured for decades and still resist'

Title: Netanyahu knew the hostages were tortured by Hamas and stayed si...
Description: A father whose son's body is held in Gaza called for Netanyahu to prioritize hostages over military gains: 'When someone causes a living person to die for political gain – it's murder.' Freed hostage Sasha Troufanov, in a video shown at a protest, urged: 'Don't let revenge outweigh life's sanctity, fight until everyone is home'

Title: Hamas releases video of freed hostage Iair Horn parting from his ...

Title: Freed hostage Eli Sharabi recounts starvation and torture in Hama...
Description: Released last month from Hamas captivity, Eli Sharabi told Israeli TV that military operations can't rescue hostages and described captivity's harrowing conditions: 'We survived on 250–300 calories a day for months.' He also said Israel's treatment of Palestinian prisoners influenced Hamas' torture tactics

Title: Freed hostage says Israel's treatment of Palestinian prisoners in...
Description: Eli Sharabi, who was released from Hamas captivity last month, told Israeli TV that it's impossible to rescue hostages through military operations due to the harrowing conditions in Gaza: We survived on 250–300 calories a day for months

Title: How Trump tried to corner war-scarred Zelenskyy and extort Ukrain...

Title: Israel is Gazafiying the West Bank, and turning these Palestinian...

Title: Israeli authorities on heightened alert as Muslim holy month, Ram...
Description: Unlike in previous years, Passover does not coincide with the dates of Ramadan this year, reducing tensions. But, Israeli security forces remain concerned over potential terrorist attacks

Title: Israeli authorities on heightened alert as Islamic holy month, Ra...
Description: Unlike in previous years, Passover does not coincide with the dates of the Muslim holy month this year, so tensions surrounding Ramadan are lower than usual, however, there are concerns within Israel's security community about attempts by terror cells to carry out attacks within the country.

Description: He told me 'You, as a Muslim, must die,'' the mother testified. She had more than a dozen stab wounds and it took her weeks to recover. Her 6-year-old son was later pronounced dead.

Title: Trump advances significant $3 billion weapons sale to Israel – th...

Title: On October 7, Israel's navy was only ready for a limited attack, ...

Title: BBC apologizes for Gaza documentary narrated by teenage son of Ha...
Description: The company that produced the documentary 'Gaza: How to Survive a War Zone' did not inform the BBC that the boy in the film is the son of a senior Hamas official who was paid for his participation. The BBC announced that the film will not be aired again
